entries.title: Shooting at Jerusalem Synagogue Kills Seven People
entries.description: Israeli authorities say the assailant was fatally shot after what they called a terrorist attack.

entries.title: The Alps Plan for a Future Without Skiing
entries.description: With snow scarce, some resorts promote biking trails and adventure parks, others try to move their ski runs to higher elevations. Many have closed.

entries.title: Assad Regime Carried Out 2018 Chlorine Attack in Syria, Investigators Say
entries.description: The findings by an international chemical-weapons watchdog add to evidence of the Syrian government’s war crimes.

entries.title: Yellen Warns South Africa About Breaching Russia Sanctions
entries.description: The treasury secretary delivered the message as the Biden administration tries to balance its response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine with a broader effort to deepen ties with African governments.

entries.title: Ukrainians on Front Lines Look to Western Tanks for Breakthrough
entries.description: Kyiv’s push to retake Kreminna in northeastern Ukraine has slowed as Russia brings in fresh troops and strengthens defensive lines around the city.

entries.title: Russia Seeks Gains in Ukraine Before Western Tanks Turn Up
entries.description: Moscow’s forces pressed an eastern offensive, trying to seize an advantage in the months before tanks pledged by Kyiv’s allies begin to arrive on the battlefield.

entries.title: Instrumental in Securing Tanks for Ukraine, Scholz Emerges With Little Credit
entries.description: The German chancellor orchestrated a larger-than-expected tank donation for Ukraine to counter a looming Russian offensive, but his reputation suffered in the process.

entries.title: China's Portrayal of Smooth Covid Exit Leaves Scientists Wanting More Data
entries.description: Some public-health experts agree with Beijing’s assessment that its outbreak has peaked—but few have any trust in the numbers behind the claim

entries.title: French Union Cuts Power to Pressure Macron on Pensions
entries.description: The strategy—cutting electricity to politicians and the wealthy while handing out discounted power and gas to the public—has drawn warnings of legal sanctions as the country prepares for another national protest next week.

entries.title: Israel's Tech Sector Opposes Judicial-Overhaul Plan
entries.description: Tech firms have said the government’s proposed changes to the top court are spooking investors worried about economic stability, the independence of the courts and a right-wing legislative agenda.

entries.title: U.S. Forces Kill Senior Islamic State Militant in Somalia
entries.description: Bilal al-Sudani and 10 other ISIS operatives were killed in a Wednesday raid in northern Somalia.
